Leo Wolf is a sound artist, musician, audio engineer, programmer, visual artist. His music combines synthesis with heavily processed samples, field recordings, and archival sounds to create hypnotic drones and textures, and is inspired by themes of memory, time, and dreams. His most recent interest is in creating works for spatial sound. He also explores physical art mediums such as monotype printmaking, and drawing.

His work in both the audio and visual realms seeks to investigate, form, and refine connections between the physical and metaphysical, viewing nature as a paradox between the inner and outer realms in which we exist. Memories, time, and symbolism in dreams serve as common sources of inspiration for these investigations.

Leo is the founder and curator of the drone and experimental label Dead Letters Archive, and co-founder of Sinetology, a Charlotte-based electronic music label and collective with a focus on hardware and live events.
